channel.title: Broadband Backup on 0x000216
channel.description: Recent content in Broadband Backup on 0x000216

item.title: Dial-Up is Alive and Kicking
item.description: In today’s world of high-speed internet, it might seem strange to talk about dial-up. Many people consider it outdated technology. However, dial-up internet access is still relevant. Millions of people still use and appreciate it for browsing the internet and checking emails. This “outdated” technology remains profitable. One of the main advantages of dial-up is its affordability. Unlimited access is available for a low monthly cost, making it a budget-friendly option compared to DSL or cable internet.

item.title: Backing Up Broadband
item.description: Over the past few decades, broadband internet has become essential for businesses, with speeds and data usage skyrocketing. This begs the question: what happens if your internet goes down? We’ve Quietly Become Dependent The shift to digital operations has been so gradual that many businesses don’t realize the impact of a complete internet outage. You understand the consequences of a power outage, but have you considered how to maintain operations if your internet connection fails?
